Result.Abstract: Stories of leadership successes follow a familiar structure: A charismatic leader, often the CEO or school principal, takes over a struggling school, establishing new goals and expectations and challenging business as usual within the organization. This leader creates new organizational routines and structures that with time transform the school's culture, contributing in turn to greater teacher satisfaction, higher teacher expectations
Result.Title: Distributed Leadership

Result.Abstract: While there is an expansive literature about what school structures, programs, and processes are necessary for instructional change, we know less about how these changes are undertaken or enacted by school leaders in their daily work. To study school leadership we must attend to lead- ership practice rather than chiefly or exclu- sively to school structures, programs, and designs. An
Result.Title: Investigating School Leadership Practice: A Distributed Perspective
Towards a theory of leadership practice: a distributed perspective

Result.Abstract: Education policy faces a familiar public policy challenge: Local implementa- tion is difficult. In this article we develop a cognitive framework to character- ize sense-making in the implementation process that is especially relevant for recent education policy initiatives, such as standards-based reforms that press for tremendous changes in classroom instruction. From a cognitive perspec- tive, a key dimension of the
Result.Title: Policy Implementation and Cognition: Reframing and Refocusing Implementation Research

Result.Title: Reform and Teaching: Exploring Patterns of Practice in the Context of National and State Mathematics Reforms

Result.Title: School Districts Matter: Local Educational Authorities and State Instructional Policy

Result.Title: Managing in the Middle: School Leaders and the Enactment of Accountability Policy

Result.Title: Distributed Leadership: Toward a Theory of School Leadership Practice

Result.Title: Making Connections to Teaching PracticeThe Role of Boundary Practices in Instructional Leadership

Result.Title: How Subjects Matter in District Office Practice: Instructionally Relevant Policy in Urban School District Redesign

Result.Title: Multimedia Cases of Practice: On-line Learning Opportunities For School Leaders

Result.Title: Exploring policy and practice relations: a teaching and learning perspective

Result.Title: Organizational Routines as Coupling Mechanisms: Policy, School Administration, and the Technical Core

Result.Title: School Principal Expertise: Putting Expert-Aspiring Principal Differences in Problem Solving Processes to the Test

Result.Title: Measuring the Learning-Centered Leadership Expertise of School Principals

Result.Title: Policy, Politics, and the National Mathematics Advisory Panel Report: Topology, Functions, and Limits

Result.Title: Using social network methods to study school leadership

Result.Abstract: Principals are increasingly expected to be the instructional as well as administrative leaders of their schools.
